temple.name: Bountiful Utah Temple
temple.history: Dedicated 8 January 1995 by Howard W. Hunter
temple.summary: The Bountiful Utah Temple was the 8th temple built in Utah and the first built in Davis County. At the 28 dedicatoty sessions, 201,655 members were in attendance-the largest number of attenders at a temple dedication in the history of the church.
temple.services: Clothing rental, cafeteria, patron housing, nearby distribution center

temple.name: Cedar City Utah Temple
temple.address: 280 S Cove Dr, Cedar City UT 84720
temple.summary: The Cedar City Utah Temple is the 17th temple built in Utha and the 170th built worldwide. It was dedicated by Henry B. Eyring.
temple.services: Clothing rental, patron housing, nearby distribution center

temple.name: Jordan River Utah Temple
temple.address: 10200 S Temple Dr, South Jordan UT 84095
temple.summary: The Jordan River Utah Temple was the 7th temple built in Utah and the only temple dedicated by President Marion G. Romney. It is the highest capacity temple in the Church with 6 ordinance rooms each seating 122 patrons. It is 1 of 5 temples featuring an angel Moroni holding the gold plates.

temple.name: Manti Utah Temple
temple.summary: The Manti Utah Temple was the 3rd temple built in Utah. It was the only temple dedicated by President Lorenzo Snow. The dramatic stairways are considered an engineering marvel of the pioneer Latter-day Saints.
temple.services: Clothing rental, cafeteria, patron housing, nearby distribution center
